panels.description: Shows CPU usage selected redis instance

targets.query: SELECT last("value") FROM "cpu/usage_rate" WHERE "type" = 'pod_container' AND "namespace_name" = '$namespace' AND "container_name" = '$container_name' AND time > now() - 150s

panels.title: CPU usage: $instance

panels.description: Shows the RAM usage of the selected redis instance
panels.title: Memory Usage: $instance

panels.description: Shows the status of redis pod

targets.expr:
min(label_replace(sum(((kube_pod_status_phase{exported_namespace="$namespace", exported_pod=~"$pod_name_history", phase="Failed"} * 12) or 
(kube_pod_status_phase{exported_namespace="$namespace", exported_pod=~"$pod_name_history", phase="Pending"} * 4) or
(kube_pod_status_phase{exported_namespace="$namespace", exported_pod=~"$pod_name_history", phase="Running"} * 1) or (kube_pod_status_ready{exported_namespace="$namespace", exported_pod=~"$pod_name_history", condition="false"} * 2) or 
(kube_pod_status_phase{exported_namespace="$namespace", exported_pod=~"$pod_name_history", phase="Succeeded"} * 8) or 
(kube_pod_status_phase{exported_namespace="$namespace", exported_pod=~"$pod_name_history", phase="Unknown"} * 16))) by (exported_pod), "redis_depl", "$1", "exported_pod", "($db_name).*")) by (redis_depl)
targets.query: SELECT last("value")/last("value") as "value"  FROM "uptime" WHERE $timeFilter and "namespace_name"='$namespace' and container_name != 'dbaas-redis-adapter' and container_name != 'redis-monitoring-agent' and  container_name != '' and  container_name != 'deployment'  group by time($__interval*3), container_name

panels.title: Redis instance status: $instance

panels.description: Shows the latency (response time) of the selected redis instance

targets.query: SELECT mean("avg_latency") FROM /^$db$/ WHERE ("host" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "server" =~ /^$instance$/)  and avg_latency >=0 AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($inter) fill(null)

panels.title: Latency: $instance

panels.description: Shows the number of clients connected to the selected redis instance

targets.query: SELECT last("clients") FROM /^$db$/ WHERE ("host" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "server" =~ /^$instance$/) AND time > now() - 150s

panels.title: Clients: $instance

panels.description: Total number of commands processed by the redis instance over 1m interval
panels.title: Command Calls: $instance

panels.description: Shows the number of operations per second for the selected redis instance

targets.query: SELECT mean("instantaneous_ops_per_sec") FROM /^$db$/ WHERE ("host" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "server" =~ /^$instance$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(none)

panels.title: Commands Executed per second: $instance

panels.description:
The hit rate is the number of cache hits divided by the total number of memory requests over a given time interval.

The miss rate is similar in form: the total cache misses divided by the total number of memory requests expressed as a percentage over a time interval.

If the cache hit ratio is lower than ~0.8 then a significant amount of the requested keys are evicted, expired, or do not exist at all. It is crucial to watch this metric while using Redis as a cache.
panels.title: Hits / Misses rate: $instance

panels.description:
Summary of Memory usage by container $instance.

The red line shows available memory volume for the container.

The orange line shows requested memory for the container.

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM "memory/usage" WHERE "type" = 'pod_container' AND "namespace_name" = '$namespace' AND "container_name" = '$container_name' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($inter), pod_name fill(linear)

SELECT mean("value") FROM "memory/request" WHERE "type" = 'pod_container' AND "namespace_name" = '$namespace' AND "container_name" = '$container_name' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($inter), pod_name fill(linear)

panels.title: Memory Usage: $instance

panels.description:
Summary of CPU usage by process $instance.

The red line shows limit of CPUs usage for the process.

The values is indicated in Millicores. It is a special Kubernates metric means CPU core split into 1000 units.

targets.query: SELECT mean(value) FROM "cpu/usage_rate" WHERE "type" = 'pod_container' AND "namespace_name" = '$namespace' AND "container_name" = '$container_name' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($inter), pod_name fill(linear)

SELECT mean(value) FROM "cpu/limit" WHERE "type" = 'pod_container' AND "namespace_name" = '$namespace' AND "container_name" = '$container_name' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($inter), pod_name fill(linear)

SELECT mean(value) FROM "cpu/request" WHERE "type" = 'pod_container' AND "namespace_name" = '$namespace' AND "container_name" = '$container_name' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($inter), pod_name fill(linear)

panels.title: CPU usage: $instance

panels.description:
Shows the RAM + mapped memory usage of the selected redis instance
Max is the maxmemory limit in config

targets.query: SELECT mean("used_memory") FROM /^$db$/ WHERE ("host" =~ /^$namespace$/ AND "server" =~ /^$instance$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($inter) fill(null)

panels.title: Redis Memory Usage: $instance

panels.description: Shows network traffic in bytes per second for the pod
panels.title: Receive/Transmit Bandwidth: $instance

panels.description:
Shows the network input and output usage of selected redis instance.
Green bars show the tx_rate for the container, meaning download volumes.
Yellow bars shows the rx_rate for the container, meaning upload volumes.
panels.title: Redis Network I/O: $instance
